1.name: Builder's Might
1.description: You have access to powers inspired by a player character from the Minecraft game. You have an inventory, can craft and gather resources with incredible speed and efficiency, and are capable of imbuing built structures with the ability to defy gravity (until they are disturbed too much). You also have enhanced physical capabilities and faster healing without scars, at the cost of increased hunger while healing or performing above human limitations. You can even respawn after death once every 24 hours in your last place of sleep, if its still intact, accessible and your soul is intact.

1.name: Crating Book
1.description: You have access to a mental compendium containing blueprints for all craftable items from the Minecraft game. It doesn't grant you skill or knowledge of the intricate inner workings of what you build, nor does it include variations of the same blueprint - just a list of specific items you know how to craft. It provides step-by-step instructions, images, and parameters to keep in mind. It doesn't give you skill or ability to use your creations, nor does it grant access to brewing, enchanting, or other supernatural capabilities. You know the specific recipes, but you lack magic and skill.

1.name: Vanilla Brewing
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to use magic for Minecraft-style brewing, along with talent in this craft and scholarly intuition - covering the general theory behind the process and how to actually apply potions in correct or unusual ways. It doesn't provide you with specific recipes but allows you to explore, test brews, and tweak existing blueprints in your possession beyond what the original game lets players do. You need this to use brewing stand effectively.

1.name: Vanilla  Enchanting
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to use magic for Minecraft-style enchantment art, along with talent in this craft and scholarly intuition - covering the general theory behind the process and how to actually apply enchanted items in correct or unusual ways. It doesn't provide you with specific recipes but allows you to explore, test, and apply enchantments to different items, and to tweak existing blueprints in your possession beyond what the original game permits. You need this perk to use the enchanting table effectively.

1.name: Jack of Basic Trades
1.description: You have basic skills and knowledge in many areas: farming, animal rearing, riding, mining, map-making, fishing, etc. Whatever the player can do in the game, you can also do on a basic level. For example, it won't be too hard for you to chop down a tree, build a simple hut, or hunt down some wild animals. However, you are still an amateur in all these areas. Still better than having nothing.

1.name: Villager Trades
1.description: You gain an average level of skill in haggling and primitive commerce. Additionally, when you roll this perk, you gain average skill and knowledge in any one villager profession of your choice. You can pay an additional 100 CP or wait for this perk being rolled again to acquire more areas of expertise until you have them all. The list of villager professions includes: Armorer, Butcher, Cartographer, Cleric, Farmer, Fisherman, Fletcher, Leatherworker, Librarian, Mason, Shepherd, Toolsmith, and Weaponsmith.

1.name: Structural Know-how
1.description: You are a skillful architect and builder. You have expertise in building all Minecraft structures that generate naturally in the game and have blueprints of them. You can use your skills to design your own projects and bring them into reality as a professional builder.

1.name: Gate Making
1.description: You have the skills, theoretical knowledge, and actual capability to build functional portals into the Nether and the End, even if the world you are currently in cannot usually access these dimensions. However, you cannot build any custom variations of portals.

1.name: Technically Infinite Dimensions
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to modify existing Nether portals to access variety of random dimensions from the April Fools Minecraft snapshot 20w14∞. You don't know what awaits you on the other side before checking things out. It can be good, it can be bad, but mostly weird, random, and chaotic. The beauty of wild magic!

1.name: Vanilla Golems
1.description: You have a supernatural ability, theoretical background knowledge and actual skill at building golems. Although, you only have blueprints for types present in the game. They listen to your orders and are generally aligned with you, although they are not very smart beyond their primary function and can be tricked easily. If they don't have any orders - they just follow their basic innate programming or become idle.

1.name: Dungeon Armory
1.description: You have access to a mental compendium containing blueprints to create all craftable weapons and armor from the Minecraft Dungeons game. You also have a basic degree of skill to actually use your creations. Although, it might be problematic to craft/use some stuff without access to specific magics.

1.name: Dunegon Artefacts
1.description: You have the ability to craft and use all artifacts and consumables from the Minecraft Dungeons game. It provides knowledge about the usage and functions of each artifact/consumable, but not actual blueprints or theories. This is mostly tinker-bullshit.

1.name: Dungeon Enchanting
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to use magic to do Minecraft Dungeons-style enchanting. It provides a few specific recipes, some basic theory, and expertise in the field. It works much better with the Vanilla Enchanting perk present but functions somewhat without it.

1.name: What Are We Looking At
1.description: This thinker power gives you some basic information about the things you directly look at. It mainly provides details such as health, name, type of the item, the level of tools needed to harvest it effectively, and so on. These are some short and useful pieces of information to know, but nothing deep.

1.name: Just Enough Items
1.description: This thinker power gives you the ability to obtain a mental blueprint to craft whatever object you are holding in your hands or currently exploring. It provides the simplest, most straightforward version of the blueprint first and uses your other perks and knowledge to provide it More complex items will require more time to obtain blueprints, or the power might not be able to give you a recipe if it’s unfeasible to create the item with the abilities you currently have. Creating a working instance of the object using the obtained blueprints can result in some new variations of the original blueprint, especially if you're lucky or if the power learns something important in the process. This is great for reverse engineering.

1.name: Waystones
1.description: This perk adds the ability to craft and enchant waystone pillars (and all accessories to use them) that you can return to once they've been activated. Either through a Warp Scroll, a rechargeable Warp Stone, or by using an existing waystone to hop from one to the other. You have the necessary skills and abilities to create things, but do not actually know how they work.

1.name: Extensive Automated Mapping
1.description: You have an ability, which is an amalgamation of functions from several minimap mods such as Xaero's Minimap or JourneyMap. This mental power gives you a customizable map that automatically updates, detects and categorizes creatures around you, and provides information like the time and other details. You can even create waypoints, but you don't have access to any fast travel functions.

1.name: Create
1.description: You have access to all blueprints, expertise, and skills to create and use devices from the Create mod for Minecraft and several famous addons for it. It's mostly about mechanical devices, factories, and some tinker-bullshit stuff here and there. Addons on the list include: Steam 'n' Rails; Crafts & Additions; Big Cannons; New Age; Enchantment Industry; Utilities; etc. It takes more time and effort to explore addons to the original: further from the main theme - the harder and more vague things become.

1.name: Thermal Expansion
1.description: This perk gives you access to all blueprints, expertise, and skills to create and operate machines from the Thermal Expansion Minecraft mod. It includes all main modules of this mod: Foundation; Cultivation; Dynamics; Innovation; Integration; Locomotion. It also includes various famous addons to the mod, but exploring these directions is more difficult, takes more time, and can be rather tedious. As you go further from the main theme of the mod and towards the addons, the tasks become harder and more vague.

1.name: Applied Refined Storage
1.description: You have access to all blueprints, a theoretical base, and the skills to create and utilize concepts from Applied Energistics and Refined Storage mods and thier various addons. Conversion of matter and energy into digital form for storage, transportation, retrieval, and even processing - these are main themes of the mod. However, as you go further from the main theme of the mod and towards the addons, things become harder and more vague to understand and create reliably.

1.name: Mekanism
1.description: You have access to blueprints of all craftable items, a theoretical base, and basic skills necessary to create machines and devices from the Mekanism mod and its various popular add-ons. This perk includes the contents of all Mekanism mod modules: Additions, Generators, and Tools. However, as you move further from the main theme of the mod and toward the add-ons, things become more complex and less straightforward to understand and create reliably.

1.name: Immersive Engineering
1.description: You have access to blueprints of all craftable items, expertise to create and operate machines and devices from the Immersive Engineering mod and its various popular addons. It also provides you with an equivalent of a high-end professional education in the area of engineering by 20th-century standards. Addons are more vague, the further away they are from original mod.

1.name: Botania
1.description: You gain access to magical abilities required to create items and structures from the Botania mod. You also gain basic theoretical background, starting blueprints, and the ability to explore more content of this mod through acts of creation, experimentation, and research. Progression and content also include some addons to the mod, but the further you go from the original theme, the more vague and tedious things become.

1.name: Tinker's Construct
1.description: You gain the needed knowledge, blueprints of craftable items, skills, and abilities to produce items and machines from Tinker's Construct mod and its various addons and extensions. This power is partly magical, allowing you to bring out unique and exotic functionalities from even seemingly mundane materials. It's even possible for you to discover some new properties and combinations of materials that are not included in the original mod and its various addons.

1.name: Doing Cool Stuff With Pressurised Air
1.description: You gain access to blueprints for craftable items from the PneumaticCraft mod and significant talent in pneumatic technology overall. It doesn't include much actual practical skill but does provide education on pneumatic systems and their applied uses.

1.name: Charging Gadgets
1.description: This is a very simple mod that adds a single block - the charging station. It is basically a full Tinkertech device, capable of recharging almost any other item from Minecraft mods, and it can even be tweaked/modified to charge other unrelated items. You don't know how it works, but you are sure it shouldn't work so well with such a simple design. On the other hand, it's an easy solution for recharging whatever devices you might have on hand. Maybe researching the thing in depth might help you to figure some little things out...

1.name: Extreme Reactors
1.description: This perk lets you build giant reactors (small by real reactor's standarts) to harness the power of the atom and mighty turbines to turn steam into energy. It mainly includes blueprints, a deep understanding with extensive expertise in maintenance and proper usage of this kind of technology (mostly specifically these reactors), and some required background theoretical information.

1.name: Mystical Agriculture
1.description: You gain a supernatural ability to craft and grow magical plants to produce resources from the Mystical Agriculture mod and its various addons. It mainly includes items from Minecraft and various mods for the game. You have a great talent for gardening and intuition for magical flora.

1.name: Vein Mining
1.description: This striker power is inspired by various mods, which allow players to mine extensive quantities of material at once. You can start chopping down a tree, activate this ability, and the whole tree will be disassembled into the needed materials much quicky by propagating effect. However, you require specific tools for each type of material/structure. It also makes you hungrier faster, and tools will break and proportionally use more energy/fuel to achieve efficient excavation for bigger quantites of material. Complex structures made from many different materials cannot be reliably broken down with vein mining and there is size limitations for each excavation. If you have a personal inventory, mined resources will go there. If not, they will be neatly piled nearby.

1.name: The Aether
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to build a working Aether portal into the dimension of the same name, even if it shouldn't work in your current world. This dimension is inspired by various versions of the Aether mod for Minecraft. You gain basic knowledge about things on the other side, some information about materials and structures of interest, and great adaptability to high altitudes. You require to have glowstone or some really close-enough material to build this portal.

1.name: Better Dimensions
1.description: If you can build portals into the Nether and the End, you now can modify them to lead into their modded versions instead. You can mix and match different combinations of mods, such as Better Nether, to extensively modify each portal and the world on the other side. However, there is only one version of a dimension for each modified portal decided by the moment you firstly created specific variation of the gates. It takes time and resources to modify a portal, and you should be able to build vanilla Minecraft portals in the first place for this ability to work. Additionally, you have extensive and in-depth knowledge about all things from different mods to change the Nether and the End. You know materials, structures, creatures, flora, dangers, and useful tricks.

1.name: Spartan Weaponry
1.description: This is an extension of blueprints for weapons, tools, and other items from vanilla Minecraft. You have enough knowledge and skills to craft items from the Spartan Weaponry and Spartan Shields mods. You also have the equivalent of extensive training to use each weapon from the mod with an above-average degree of finesse, along with great talent to easily advance these skills toward mastery.

1.name: Draconic Evolution
1.description: This perk gives you knowledge, blueprints of craftable items, and skills to create and utilize things from the Draconic Evolution mod. It includes many high-tier items and is quite resource-intensive. It's more of a magitech creation capability. Don't accidentally explode yourself and your neighbors.

1.name: Dis-Enchanting
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to create and operate devices or machines for dis-enchanting work. You now have a way to recover enchantments from enchanted objects or books. It is mostly inspired by the mod of the same name as the perk. This works best for Minecraft-style and closely related types of enchanting. It is basically useless for other situations.

1.name: Ore Generation
1.description: Congratulations! After acquiring this perk, you can force Minecraft-style ore generation into any landscape you target once. Within a radius of one thousand chunks (around 1,600 meters) around you, different ores from vanilla Minecraft will appear underground - ranging from coal and iron to amethyst geodes and redstone. All ores have unique properties inspired by their source game. You can hold this effect activation for as long as you want, until you find a place you like to target and use it. This perk can be rolled multiple times stockpiling activations in storage. Each additional roll after the first buy will be discounted to 200 CP.

1.name: Cheap Storage Solutions
1.description: You have the ability to create chests, drawers, and other vessels to store an impossible quantity of items. Some of these are good at storing only objects of a specific type, while others can be filled with anything (which can lead to sorting problems). It includes some tools to assist with sorting and devices inspired by mods like Storage Drawers, Sophisticated Backpacks and Iron Chests allowing you to experiment with many functions. However, this perk is essentially tinkertech on maximum settings. Maybe later, you'll be able to create actual 'bigger on the inside' boxes without fiat reality warping enforcing things to just work.

1.name: Tempad
1.description: This perk gives you access to blueprints for craftable items from the Tempad mod, along with specks of basic theory and skills to actually use all the devices provided by this perk. It is mainly about creating portals and instantly traveling within the world.

1.name: EvilCraft
1.description: This perk gives you supernatural capabilities, basic knowledge, and starting blueprints to explore and utilize content inspired by the EvilCraft mod for Minecraft. You gain one Dark Gem from this perk for free, know how to use it in a ritual to obtain a special book.

1.name: Oritech
1.description: You gain access to blueprints for craftable items, methodologies, and levels of scientific knowledge to create, maintain, and use devices from the Oritech mod for Minecraft.

1.name: Modular Force Field Systems
1.description: This perk gives you blueprints and skills to create, use, and maintain a variety of devices from the Modular Force Field Systems mod for Minecraft. It can be built relatively cheaply if you really go full tinkertech. However, you have almost no knowledge about how these forcefields function on fundamental level.

1.name: Thaumcraft
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to use Thaumcraft-style magic and conduct unusually fast and efficient research into the contents of this mod. The contents include various versions of the mod and famous addons for it as well. You can awaken ability to use magic in other people with this perk and some ingenuity.

1.name: Ender IO
1.description: This perk gives you access to blueprints of all craftable items from the Ender IO Minecraft mod, as well as general theory and basic skills to utilize devices from this mod.

1.name: Mining Gadgets
1.description: "Sometimes you want a quick change of pace when it comes to mining. Pickaxes. Drills. Bores. Robots. Quarries. These are all great options. Now you can use lasers too if you want." You have blueprints to craft such tools and great skill in using them in practice. You can easily go full tinkertech with this perk.

1.name: Iron Jetpacks
1.description: You can build and expertly use devices from the Iron Jetpacks mod. They are full-blown tinkertech machines, mostly without any actual theory or reasonable explanation of how they work.

1.name: Tetra
1.description: You gain access to all the necessary skills and knowledge to modify tools and weapons in the style of the Tetra mod. This can even be applied to things beyond the scope of this mod, if you are creative.

1.name: Biomancy
1.description: You have access to blueprints, knowledge, and the necessary magical ability to make devices and machines from the Biomancy mod.

1.name: Industrial Craft
1.description: You have access to blueprints, knowledge, and basic skills to create machines and devices from the Industrial Craft mod, its different versions, and addons. The more you stray from the original mod's theme and into addons, the harder it becomes to make sense of things.

1.name: Ex Nihilo
1.description: You are capable of creating anomalous tools inspired by the Ex Nihilo Minecraft mod and its various addons. It basically allows you to create seemingly simple machines/tools and utilize them to produce resources literally from nothing. Not a lot, and with many caveats, but now you can scramble some little bits of needed materials even in the middle of nowhere, where access is limited to only scraps and dirt.

1.name: The Undergarden
1.description: You are able to craft a special tool and activate a portal with it, which will lead to the newly generated Undergarden dimension, named after the same. You have encyclopedic knowledge about this new world and the basic skills needed to survive. You are also immune to all potential diseases this place might contain.

1.name: RFTools Dimensions
1.description: Congratulations! You've got access to a number of tinkertech machines to create your own custom dimensions! Yes, they are stupidly energy-hungry and tedious to program. Yes, they require you to periodically maintain and watch closely over their work... But you can have your own procedurally generated ocean of liquid gold, or maybe an infinite field of giant truffles!

1.name: Immersive Portals
1.description: You have the power to manipulate and create portals, cut doors into other accessible dimensions, and modify existing portals. This power is inspired by the Immersive Portals mod for Minecraft. You can do everything this mod allows, but with some additional possibilities and more extensive, detailed implications of carving space in this way. Be careful. It might give you some intuition and feedback, but the power is not foolproof.

1.name: The Twilight Forest
1.description: You have the ability to create a portal that leads to the newly generated Twilight Forest dimension from the mod of the same name. The contents of the dimension include all connected addons of the original mod. You have general knowledge about important aspects of the dimension: its dangers, useful materials, flora and fauna, and mystical laws.

1.name: Better Questing
1.description: There are many modpacks with some sort of quest system or book. Now, you are capable of creating personal, soul-bound quest books for people. One person can only have one such book, and it cannot be destroyed by usual means because it is a projection of their inner world. It contains unique and dynamically updating quests for each person. Finishing quests from the book allows one to receive thematic rewards. However, what kind of quests and rewards one gets depends a lot on what kind of person they are: what they want, what they believe, what they know, etc.

1.name: Mining Dimension
1.description: You are capable of creating a mystical portal leading into a dimension inspired by Aroma1997's Dimensional World mod for Minecraft. The contents of the world on the other side of the portal depend on the other perks you already have at the moment of portal creation. When you build the portal, the dimension is actualized, and new perks obtained after this point will not affect the contents of the mining world. However, you can roll and buy this perk several times (costing you only 350 CP) and gain the ability to create another variation of the dimension, separated from the first one and working by the same perk-content rules.

1.name: Tasty-Tasty Addon!
1.description: You are a skilled cook and have a mental compendium of all recipes and blueprints for tools and devices from Farmer's Delight, Cooking for Blockheads, Pam's HarvestCraft, and other similar 'tasty' mods, along with their many variations and addons. You also possess just enough basic skills to obtain all the ingredients for your cooking.

1.name: Ars Nouveau
1.description: "Ars Nouveau is a magic mod inspired by Ars Magicka that allows players to craft their own spells, create magical artifacts, perform rituals, and much more." You gain the necessary magical abilities to use and create things from this mod, along with basic blueprints, general theory, and talent to quickly progress along this path. Including addons to the mod.

1.name: ProjectE
1.description: You are capable of creating and using a special supernatural tools and devices to exchange one material for another. The core concept of the mod, EMC (Energy-Matter Currency), is a value assigned to items and blocks representing their energy cost or worth. Players can store, transfer, and convert EMC to facilitate item duplication or transmutation.

1.name: Blood Magic
1.description: "Blood Magic is an arcane art that is practiced by mages who attempt to gather a vast amount of power through utilizing a forbidden material: blood. Even though it does grant a huge amount of power, every single action that is performed with this volatile magic can prove deadly. You have been warned." You gain the necessary magical abilities to use and create things from this mod, along with basic blueprints, general theory, and talent to quickly progress along this path. Including addons to the mod.

1.name: Astral Sorcery
1.description: "Astral Sorcery is a magic mod focused around harnessing the powers of starlight and the constellations." You gain the necessary magical abilities to use and create things from this mod, along with basic blueprints, general theory, and talent to quickly progress along this path. Including addons to the mod.

1.name: Ensorcellation
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to use magic for Ensorcellation mod enchantment art, along with talent in this craft and scholarly intuition to actually apply enchanted items in correct or unusual ways. However, if you don't have access to Vamilla Minecraft Enchanting, your creations inevitably will be tinkertech, and your knowledge will have holes in it. You still can create things, just with limitations.

1.name: Doggy Talents Next
1.description: "This mod aims to create Harmony between the dogs and the player throughout the game. Imagine playing a Piano Concerto, you as the pianist and the dogs as the orchestra. When the two sounds are being played, it creates harmony, which our ears love so much. Thus, the orchestra doesn't overwhelm but empowers the pianist. The mod is and will be designed along that principle. The dogs should accompany the player well while not becoming overpowered in the context. Although when on-demand, sufficient abilities should be granted to them, they should be required to work to achieve those. And you, the responsible owner, should help them." You have special talent to make content from this mod reality.

1.name: Modded Ores
1.description: Congratulations! After acquiring this perk, you can force Minecraft-style ore generation into any landscape you target once. Within a radius of one thousand chunks (around 1,600 meters) around you, different ores from one mod of your choice, for which you possess the perk, will appear underground. Depending on the mod you have chosen for the specific generation effect, the ores can be very different. All ores have unique properties inspired by their source mod. You can hold this effect activation for as long as you want, until you find a place you like to target and use it. This perk can be rolled multiple times, stockpiling activations in storage. You decide which mod will be used to source the types of ores at the moment of casting the effect. Each additional roll after the first purchase will be discounted to 350 CP.

1.name: Simply Skills
1.description: This perk gives you access to the skill tree from the Simply Skills mod for Minecraft. You can obtain points to 'learn' new effects and abilities through good fights and via living through unique and/or interesting adventures. What counts as a 'good fight' and a 'suitable experience' depends on your current abilities and present experiences. As a consolidation price, you gain one point to spend after buying this perk and receive a random accessible skill from the tree each month.

1.name: Improvable Skills
1.description: This perk gives you access to the skill tree from the Improvable Skills mod for Minecraft. You can obtain points to 'learn' new effects and abilities via living through unique and/or interesting experiences. What counts as a 'suitable experience' depends on your current abilities and present experiences. As a consolidation price, you gain one point to spend after buying this perk and receive a random accessible skill from the tree each month.

1.name: Dark Utilities
1.description: "The Dark Utilities mod adds many new items and blocks that expand upon the vanilla game. This mod aims to be useful in a wide range of circumstances while also adding fun and interesting mechanics." You gain the ability to build all devices from this mod and know how to use them. It's really easy to 'tinker' with this technology.

1.name: Simply Swords
1.description: You gain exceptional smithing skills focused on the creation of items from the Simply Swords mod for Minecraft. You also have great talent at wielding all types of weapons presented in the Simply Swords mod (including unique), but no actual skills to use them.

1.name: It's Gold in Here!
1.description: When exploring new places in person, you have a chance to find some unique materials/resources from the Mythic Metals and the Gobber mods for Minecraft. Even if it doesn't make much sense to find them there, and they definitely weren't there before you explored the area. But this only happens in new places you explore in person. It is proportionally less effective the more you already know about the location before exploration: the more you know, the worse the effect. It can be toggled on or off or set to work partially, causing some materials to appear while others do not. Materials are only found in places similar to where they usually generate or are found in the game. You can roll and buy this perk multiple times, with a discount up to 200 CP. This will allow you to include other materials in generation from the Minecraft perks you currently possess - you can choose one. If you don't have any, you can choose to make this perk select a random source for you. from all Minecraft mods with materials/resources content.

1.name: Almost Unified
1.description: This perk is inspired by the Almost Unified mod for Minecraft. You gain exceptional expertise in the field of material science, along with keen intuition and a supernatural advantage when working on replacing the materials in your creations with similar ones. If you don't have access to some exotic metal, you might figure out a special alloy from things you have access to use instead.

1.name: Actually Additions
1.description: "Use the Atomic Reconstructor and the Empowerer to turn minerals into powerful crystals that allow the creation of useful machines for processing and sorting items, lasers for wirelessly transporting energy, items and fluids, renewable oil to generate power, and much more."

1.name: Large Ore Deposits
1.description: This perk gives you the power to perform a special ritual. By sacrificing targeted material (seed) you have and a few other items (depending on the main material), you can force the generation of a large ore deposit underground at your position, containing raw ore inspired by the sacrificed seed. The more esoteric and unique the material, the more elaborate, complex, and costly the ritual becomes. You can only use this ritual every 24 hours, and it can fail if you are underprepared or make a mistake.

1.name: Forestry
1.description: You gain access to content inspired by Forestry for Minecraft. You can create, use, and even modify things from this mod and its various addons. It doesn't provide a lot of knowledge, but it offers a lot of pure capability. Includes skills of a supernatural beekeeper!

1.name: Theurgy
1.description: You gain knowledge and ability to utilise mechanics and create mahines/devices/materials from the Minecraft mod Theurgy and its various addons

1.name: TerraFirmaCraft
1.description: You gain the knowledge and skills needed to progress through the entire tech tree from the TerraFirmaCraft mod for Minecraft and its various addons. You can start with nothing but nature around you and still create many useful things to start a civilization.

1.name: Silent Gear
1.description: "The mod focuses on tools, weapons, and armor (collectively called gear). Recipes are modular, down to each individual piece used in crafting. Possible combinations for each gear type are practically unlimited." You have ability to create different gear from the mod Silent Gear and its various addons. This perk's ability has supernatural component.

1.name: Jewelry and Baubles
1.description: You become a highly skillful jeweler with the special ability to create various magical pieces of jewelry and utilize them effectively. This perk includes content from mods: Iron's Gems 'n Jewelry, Jewelry (RPG Series), and Magical Jewelry, along with their add-ons.

1.name: Modular Machinery
1.description: "A modpack-maker toolset to create custom, massive, unique and complex machines and recipes from scratch" This perk grants great knowledge of modular machine-making methodology, along with ability to utilise supernatural advantage, as you design and build modular modifications for creations you know how to make. Heavily inspired by the mod of the same name.

1.name: Extended Crafting
1.description: "Extended Crafting adds more ways to craft items, more items to craft with, and more utilities for crafting. The mod doesn't do much on it's own and is intended to be configured heavily. All the recipes and settings should be changed to fit the progression of the modpack it's in and how the modpack developer wants it to be used." This perk grants great knowledge of extended crafting methodology, along with ability to utilise supernatural advantage, as you design and apply modifications for blueprints you already know. It also includes blueprints to create basic machinery from the mod. Essentially, it lets you change how you craft things and find new ways to do so, using what you already know and have.

1.name: Advanced Generators
1.description: This perk provides a mental compendium of blueprints for creating machines and devices from the Advanced Generators mod for Minecraft, along with basic skills and deep insight into energy-generation technology and its applications. Basically, this perk makes it easier to tweak various generators you know how to build, or to find ways to connect some machines to generators, even when such connections are usually incompatible with the machine in question. You know how to think about and generally solve such problems.

1.name: Simple Generators
1.description: This perk gives you the ability to create different machines from the Simple Generators mod for Minecraft. They generate power, obviously. However, these generators are mostly tinkertech, and you gain great skill and a supernatural advantage from this perk only while working on the generators from this perk: building, maintaining, using, and connecting them. Although, it still gives you some useful and unique theoretical knowledge.

1.name: Psi Technology
1.description: "Psi is a magical tech spell programming mod inspired by Mahouka Kokou no Rettousei. Don't worry if that doesn't make any sense." You gain the ability to use devices from this mod, along with blueprints for all craftable items, an extensive theoretical base, and some talent for utilising this kind of magical technology.

2.name: Bag of Wheat Seeds
2.description: "One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes." You gain a full bag of wheat seeds of random quality from the Stardew Valley game. You can hold off releasing the bag into the world for as long as you like. They work like normal plants if left to grow in the wild. However, if someone or something plays an active role in cultivating and tending to this wheat, it starts to grow abnormally fast (maximum speed of 4 days to fully grow in perfect conditions). It still exhausts the soil just as much as normal plants do. So it's probably a bad idea to harvest wheat every week. It is a summer/fall crop - its supernatural effect is most effective in summer and autumn. This perk can be purchased multiple times.

It still exhausts the soil just as much as normal plants do. So it's probably a bad idea to harvest Sweet Gem Berries every three weeks. It is a fall crop - its supernatural effect is most effective in autumn. This perk can be purchased multiple times.

2.name: Artisan Goods
2.description: You gain extreme talent and above-average skill in creating various artisan goods inspired by Stardew Valley, along with the knowledge to create all the tools and goods you need. You also have a supernatural edge when crafting items similar to Stardew Valley artisan goods. The supernatural advantage is toggleable.

2.name: Fishing Mastery
2.description: You gain extreme talent and above-average skill in the field of fishing inspired by Stardew Valley game, along with the knowledge to create all the tools and goods you need. You also have a supernatural edge when crafting items connected to this field and when actually fishing. The supernatural advantage is toggleable.

2.name: Chicken Coop
2.description: "Well cared-for adult chickens lay eggs every day. Lives in the coop." This perk provides a coop full of chickens. You can delay releasing this into the world for as long as you want. Animals from this perk are unusually obedient to you, and when someone actively takes care of them, they become supernaturally productive. This perk can be purchased multiple times.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: Blood Rights
3.description: "Mass Enemy Damage at a Cost." This perk grants you a straight razor artifact with special properties and basic knowledge of how to use it. When used to cut yourself, it deals consistent damage and doesn't cause bleeding. This action will inflict damage on everyone you perceive as enemies around you (mostly in the form of internal trauma and cuts). It doesn't have any special effects when used to cut other creatures - just an exceptionally durable and always sharp razor. It has a cooldown for its main effect and provides feedback about it to the current user.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: Candy Heart
3.description: "Power of Love." This perk grants you incremental upgrades to a few randomly chosen physical stats after healing from wounds. It only works if the healed wound was severe enough and the healing process was fast enough (like regeneration). The upgrades are tiny but permanent.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: Empty Heart
3.description: "It Multiplies." This perk lets you completely heal from crippling and other negative side effects of wounds and ailments if your health falls below a certain threshold. It is as quick as your normal recovery speed. For example, it can fix wrongly fused bones after fracture recovery, but not smaller scars left behind by this wound. Or you can regain your lost eye: fully or partially, depending on your health status.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: Cracked Orb
3.description: "Shards of Knowledge." Each time you take damage exceeding a certain severity, you gain one of the following boons: useful insight about your surroundings; closed/blocked passages nearby being opened; or useful items being uncovered and brought to your attention from nearby area. It is mostly random but depends on what is around you and the situation you are in.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: Bloody Gust
3.description: "May your rage bring haste." Each time you take damage in a fight, it boosts your speed and agility temporarily until reaching a certain maximum. There are six 'stages' to the effect. It decays rapidly outside combat.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: Keeper's Sack
3.description: "Balls." Each time you purchase something from a willing trader, you receive a random permanent physical stat upgrade proportional to your spendings. It works better for large one-time expenditures made in person, where actual goods are being bought and spent sum is big enough to trigger the effect. It's very finicky about what counts as a "purchase" and cannot be cheated, not easily.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: Forget Me Now
3.description: "I don't remember..." This perk gives you a special pill. It lets you "reset" your day once - right after taking it, traveling back 24 hours. You bring items on your person, memories, and other perks into the past with you, along with your current physical state. For instance, if you are wounded at the moment of pill effect activation, you will still be wounded afterward. This perk can be purchased multiple times. Remember, traveling back doesn't mean things will happen in exactly the same way. You gain general knowledge about the pill effect from the perk.

3.__source: Celestial Something - 11  The Binding of Isaac
3.name: The Hourglass
3.description: "Temporary enemy slowdown." You gain an hourglass, which can be used to slow down everyone you perceive as enemies around you for eight seconds. It has a cooldown. The item also provides feedback about the recharge status and knowledge of the Hourglass use to the holder. The effect is not temporal in nature, but inertial/kinetic - doesn't slow perception of time.

4.name: Red Science
4.description: You gain the ability to gradually acquire both theoretical and practical knowledge of Factorio-style automation. You start with basic stuff from the perk and need to build and use devices, as well as proactively automate processes, to push this ability further and further until you reach a limit of the perk decided by Factorio game content.

4.name: Green Science
4.description: You gain the ability to gradually acquire both theoretical and practical knowledge of Factorio-style logistics. You start with basic stuff from the perk and need to build and use devices, as well as proactively utilise industrial logistics, to push this ability further and further until you reach a limit of the perk decided by Factorio game content.

4.name: Gray Science
4.description: You gain the ability to gradually acquire both theoretical and practical knowledge of Factorio-style military production. You start with basic stuff from the perk and need to build and use military devices, to push this ability further and further until you reach a limit of the perk decided by Factorio game content. Conflict using devices created by your play a big role in progressing this tech-tree. You need actual battles for the best returns.

4.name: Blue Science
4.description: You gain the ability to gradually acquire both theoretical and practical knowledge of Factorio-style chemical science and production. You start with basic stuff from the perk and need to build and use devices, as well as proactively utilise chemical science to push this ability further and further until you reach a limit of the perk decided by Factorio game content.

4.name: Purple Science
4.description: You gain the ability to gradually acquire both theoretical and practical knowledge of Factorio-style production. You start with basic stuff from the perk and need to build and use devices, as well as proactively produce variety of things using knowledge from this perk, to push this ability further and further until you reach a limit of the perk decided by Factorio game content.

4.name: Yellow Science
4.description: You gain the ability to gradually acquire both theoretical and practical knowledge of Factorio-style high tech and utility. You start with basic stuff from the perk and need to build and use devices, as well as proactively produce variety of things using knowledge from this perk, to push this ability further and further until you reach a limit of the perk decided by Factorio game content.

4.name: White Science
4.description: You gain the ability to gradually acquire both theoretical and practical knowledge of Factorio-style space technology. You start with basic stuff from the perk and need to build and use devices, as well as proactively explore and travel space using knowledge from this perk, to push this ability further and further until you reach a limit of the perk decided by Factorio game content. Space exploration and travel are needed to achieve the best returns for this perk.

4.name: Space Age
4.description: You gain a mental compendium of theoretical scientific knowledge and blueprints of craftable items from the Space Age expansion pack for Factorio. Applying these blueprints and knowledge in practice will help you gain expertise in the usage and creation of technologies from this expansion at an incredibly rapid rate, gaining actual skills in leaps.

4.name: Biters and Other Pests
4.description: You have a mental compendium of research on various enemies from the Factorio game, including the Space Age expansion. You also possess tactical skills to fight and exploit these different creatures. You are talented at researching alien hostile life and producing countermeasures against such biological dangers.

4.name: Shield Projector
4.description: You are capable of creating a device that projects an energy shield in an arc - a wall that only needs energy to sustain itself. This device can be built relatively easily if you go full tinkertech. You gain only basic scientific knowledge and one blueprint of a specific device from this perk. It is inspired by the mod of the same name.

4.name: Advanced Autonomous Industries
4.description: This perk includes blueprints for all craftable items and machines from the Advanced Autonomous Industries mod, along with its various modules and addons. It also provides you with just enough scientific knowledge to somewhat understand your creations, as well as the skills to utilize, build, and reliably maintain this kind of technology.

4.name: Factory Planner
4.description: This perk includes programs and simple devices ideal for planning your production in advance, specifying the recipes and machines that make up each assembly line. Basically tools for planning automated factory, enough computer science and design skills to actually create and use these programs.

4.name: Repair Turret
4.description: You are capable of creating a tower-like structure that uses energy beams to repair your structures, spending energy and repair kits to do so. This device can be built relatively easily if you go full tinkertech. You gain only basic scientific knowledge and one blueprint of a specific device from this perk, but you don't actually know how it works or if it's even possible to build it using completely mundane science and tech without cheating. It is inspired by the mod of the same name.

4.name: Pyanodons Addons
4.description: This perk includes blueprints for all craftable items and machines from the Pyanodons mods, along with its various modules and addons. It also provides you with just enough scientific knowledge to somewhat understand your creations, as well as the skills to utilize, build, and reliably maintain this kind of technology.

4.name: Modular Turrets
4.description: Perk inspired by the Modular Turrets mod for Factorio. You have the blueprints and enough skills to build, operate, and maintain turrets from the mod. You can go full tinkertech with them to make things very cheap, or go full true tech. Modularity is not the only flexibility these machines provide.

4.name: Infinite Source
4.description: Once you buy this perk, you can choose one existing resource deposit nearby to apply a replenishing quality to it. This resource source will become endlessly replenishable, as long as you don't mine it too actively. There is a limit to how fast it will replenish, depending on the nature of the material, and there is an upper limit on how large or complex the targeted deposit can be. Coal replenishes much faster than something like redstone, for instance. The farther away the resource is from Factorio-style materials, the less effective this shaker effect becomes. This perk can be purchased multiple times, and its effects can be stockpiled in your inventory until you find a suitable target and spend them. Second and all subsequent purchases will cost only 400 CP.

4.name: Electric Weapons
4.description: Perk inspired by the mod of the same name. It adds several blueprints of electric weapons to your mental compendium, along with in-depth scientific knowledge about how they work, and a degree of skill to use and modify them.

4.name: Robot Army
4.description: Perk inspired by the mod of the same name. It lets you manufacture and deploy automated robot soldiers to attack your foes and defend your factory! You have blueprints for craftable items from the mod, and you know how to program and command these machines.

4.name: Krastorio
4.description: You have a mental compendium of all blueprints for craftable items from the Krastorio mod for Factorio, and enough basic understanding of the theory to somewhat grasp this technology. However, if there is not enough contextual knowledge from other perks, there might be some blank spots and enforced tinkertech approaches in the technology. After all, you cannot reliably know and build higher levels of Factorio tech given by this perk if you don't know this tech in the first place. There will be some interesting consequences.

4.name: Bob's Power
4.description: Gives you the ability to build new power structures added by the Bob's Power mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Logistics
4.description: Gives you the ability to build all logistics related things added by the Bob's Logistics mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Warfare
4.description: Gives you the ability to create all warfare-related devices added by the Bob's Warfare mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Assembling Machines
4.description: Gives you the ability to build and use all new tiers of assembling machines added by the Bob's Assembling Machines mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Mining
4.description: Gives you the ability to build and use all new mining machines and tools added by the Bob's Mining mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Materials
4.description: This perk provides a mental compendium and blueprints to utilize resource processing and material production from Bob's Metals, Chemicals and Intermediates, and Bob's Ores mods. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Electronics
4.description: Gives you the ability to create a whole new electronics production chains inspired by Bob's Electronics mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Modules
4.description: Gives you the ability to make and use all modules added by Bob's Modules mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Tech
4.description: This perk lets you learn theoretical facts about technology provided by other Bob's mods. It doesn't give you blueprints or specific applied knowledge about technology, but it fills in the gaps and allows you to integrate elements from other Bob's mods into different kinds of technologies. It also offers more non-tinkertech solutions to explore. You gain data slowly, but faster if you actually build and use things from Bob's mods perks.

4.name: Bob's Vehicle Equipment
4.description: Gives you the ability to build and use all equipment added by Bob's Vehicle Equipment mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Greenhouse
4.description: Gives you the ability to build a greenhouse from Bob's Greenhouse mod for Factorio. This is a pretty bizarre and unnaturally effective structure to produce wood - at least not magical types. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Bob's Personal Equipment
4.description: Gives you the ability to create and use all pieces of personal equipment added by Bob's Personal Equipment mod for Factorio. This perk stacks and synergizes greatly with other Bob mods. However, it is more tinkertech on its own, but becomes less so as more Bob mods are stacked on top of each other. The more of them you have, the more capable you are of discarding the tinkertech approach in favor of true technologies provided by all related perks.

4.name: Spidertron Extended
4.description: This perk adds to your repertoire of blueprints: Spidertron MK2, Spidertron MK3, the Immolator, the Ghost Weaver, and Major Spidertron - more powerful upgraded versions of the Spidertron that can be crafted from the original, with enhanced firing capabilities, larger inventory size, equipment grid, radar coverage, mobility, and much more. It works weirdly and enforces tinkertech if you don't have access to the original Factorio Spidertron technology.

5.name: Electromagnetism
5.description: "Maxwell's equations poetically describe electricity and magnetism intertwining. With a deeper understanding, machines can be created for acquiring and using electrical energy with high efficiency." - This perk gives you scientific knowledge and blueprtints to create devices unlocked by the technology of the same name from the DSP game.

5.name: Tier Two Technology
5.description: This perk gives you a mental compendium of scientific knowledge and blueprints to understand, craft, and maintain all devices and structures of Tier Two technology from the DSP game. You can obtain this perk without perks for previous Tiers, but there will be expected holes in your understanding. You can reroll this perk for free.

5.name: End Game Technology
5.description: This perk gives you a mental compendium of scientific knowledge and blueprints to understand, craft, and maintain all devices and structures of Tier Thirteen and above technology from the DSP game. You can obtain this perk without perks for previous Tiers, but there will be expected holes in your understanding. You can reroll this perk for free.

5.name: Icarus
5.description: You have the ability to build the basic Icarus mecha from DSP. You have the blueprint and extensive skills to maintain and use this machine, but you don't have complete knowledge of its inner workings. It has high tinkertech cheating potential to cut corners to create this mecha.

5.name: Exploration Upgrades
5.description: This perk gives you the thinker ability to search for and view resources around you. It cannot highlight every kind of resources - only works best with DSP and related types of materials. This perk can be purchased four times in total, costing 100 CP more for each purchase.

5.name: Mecha Upgrades I
5.description: You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier One upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. Yes, it can be tinkertech-cheated relatively easily.

5.name: Mecha Upgrades II
5.description: You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier Two upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. Yes, it can be tinkertech-cheated relatively easily. You can buy this perk without having previous ones, but there will be expected gaps in your knowledge and abilities. You can reroll this perk for free.

5.name: Mecha Upgrades III
5.description: You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier Three upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. Yes, it can be tinkertech-cheated relatively easily. You can buy this perk without having previous ones, but there will be expected gaps in your knowledge and abilities. You can reroll this perk for free.

5.name: Mecha Upgrades IV
5.description: You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier Four upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. Yes, it can be tinkertech-cheated relatively easily. You can buy this perk without having previous ones, but there will be expected gaps in your knowledge and abilities. You can reroll this perk for free.

5.description: You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier Five upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. 5.description: You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier Six upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. You can reroll this perk for free.

5.name: Mecha Upgrades VII+
5.description: You gain blueprints and skills to implement Tier Seven and above upgrades for the Icarus Mecha. It includes a basic level of scientific understanding, but it is very limited. Yes, it can be tinkertech-cheated relatively easily. You can buy this perk without having previous ones, but there will be expected gaps in your knowledge and abilities. You can reroll this perk for free.

5.name: Building Upgrades
5.description: This mental compendium of blueprints and the necessary knowledge allows you to create and implement building upgrades from the DSP game. It works much better with DSP technology. You can reverse engineer upgradable buildings using only this perk in theory, but it would be tedious, awkward, and would take a lot of time and testing. Infinite Tiers become more and more vague, incomplete, until unrecognizable in the compendium of this perk.

5.name: Combat Upgrades
5.description: This mental compendium of blueprints and the necessary knowledge allows you to create and implement combat upgrades from the DSP game. It works much better with DSP technology. You can reverse engineer upgradable items and structures using only this perk in theory, but it would be tedious, awkward, and would take a lot of time and testing. Infinite Tiers become more and more vague, incomplete, until unrecognizable in the compendium of this perk.

6.name: Neolithic Projects
6.description: You gain knowledge and all the necessary skills to build and create things by completing Neolithic Research Projects in the RimWorld game. It includes both specific blueprints and basic level of skills. Doesn't include DLCs content.

6.name: Medieval Projects
6.description: You gain knowledge and all the necessary skills to build and create things by completing Medieval Research Projects in the RimWorld game. It includes both specific blueprints and basic level of skills. Doesn't include DLCs content.

6.name: Industrial Projects
6.description: You gain knowledge and all the necessary skills to build and create things by completing Industrial Research Projects in the RimWorld game. It includes both specific blueprints and basic level of skills. Doesn't include DLCs content.

6.name: Spacer Projects
6.description: You gain knowledge and all the necessary skills to build and create things by completing Spacer Research Projects in the RimWorld game. It includes both specific blueprints and basic level of skills. Doesn't include DLCs content.

6.name: Biotech
6.description: This perk provides you with the necessary scientific base, basic skills, and blueprints for specific pieces of technology/projects to create items and do various projects from the Biotech DLC for the RimWorld game.

6.name: Royalty
6.description: This perk provides you with the necessary scientific base, basic skills, degree of psycasting potential and blueprints for specific pieces of technology/projects to create items and do various things from the Royalty DLC for the RimWorld game.

6.name: Odyssey
6.description: This perk provides you with the necessary scientific base, basic skills and blueprints for specific pieces of technology/projects to create items and do various things from the Odyssey DLC for the RimWorld game.

6.name: Anomaly
6.description: This perk provides you with the necessary scientific base, basic skills and blueprints for specific pieces of technology/projects to create items and do various things from the Anomaly DLC for the RimWorld game. All potential infohazards from the perk are hidden from you, if it would hurt you to know.

6.name: Ideology
6.description: This perk provides you with the necessary scientific base, basic skills, degree of supernatural ability and blueprints for specific pieces of technology/projects to create items and do various things from the Ideology DLC for the RimWorld game. All potential infohazards from the perk are hidden from you, if it would hurt you to know. This perk makes you more socially adept and more talented in all talented in social sciences.

6.name: Redistribute Passion
6.description: This perk gives you three metaphorical charges, which you can use to temporarily gain Passion towards some skill from the list of existing in RimWorld game. You can invest one charge to become Interested or two to gain Burning status. It doesn't actually make you more skillful, but it allows you to take pleasure in doing something and provides a multiplier on experience gain. Charges reset every 24 hours and need to be re-applied. You can also apply them to other people, but they only return to you after 24 hours have passed. You must use all three charges at the same time when activating this perk. Beware of unintended psychological effects.

6.name: Obtain Traits
6.description: After buying this perk, you can choose any trait from the list of existing traits in the RimWorld game. You will have this one chosen trait in reserve, waiting to be used by you. You can apply it to yourself or to another person you touch. It takes a few minutes to apply the chosen trait. The effect causes permanent changes to the target. Same traits do not stack, but may cause unpredictable consequences when applied. This perk can be rolled multiple times. Beware of unintended psychological/physiological effects.

6.name: Acquire Skills
6.description: After buying this perk, you can choose any skill from the list of existing skills in the RimWorld game. You will have this chosen skill in reserve, waiting to be used by you. You can apply it to yourself or another person you touch to gain or give two levels of the skill (maximum of 20). It takes a few minutes to apply chosen skill. This perk can be rolled multiple times.

6.name: Vanilla Weapons Expande
6.description: You gain a mental compendium of blueprints for craftable items from the Vanilla Weapons Expanded series of mods for RimWorld, along with the skills and knowledge needed to practically utilize and create these items effectively.

6.name: Vanilla Furniture Expanded
6.description: You gain a mental compendium of blueprints for craftable items from the Vanilla Furniture Expanded series of mods for RimWorld, along with the skills needed to practically utilize and create these items effectively. However, it doesn't include any in-depth scientific knowledge.

6.name: Vanilla Genetics Expanded
6.description: You gain a mental compendium of blueprints for craftable items from the Vanilla Genetics Expanded mod for RimWorld, along with the skills needed to practically utilize and create these items effectively. However, it doesn't include any in-depth scientific knowledge and is tinkertech, if you don't have Biotech perk from RimWorld category.

6.name: Vanilla Vehicles Expande
6.description: You gain a mental compendium of blueprints for craftable items from the Vanilla Vehicles Expande series of mods for RimWorld, along with the skills needed to practically utilize and create these items effectively. It also includes some degree of talent for any vehicle-related mechanic fields.

6.name: Rimsenal Pack
6.description: You gain a mental compendium of blueprints for items, structures and even some creatures from the Rimsenal Pack of mods for RimWorld, along with the skills needed to practically utilize and create these items effectively. It also includes incredible talent for utilizing weapons for their main purpose. It contains only basic background scientific knowledge. Easily turned into tinkertech.

6.name: Lost Factory Mechanoids
6.description: This perk gives you the ability to create a small factory project for the production of machines and devices from the Lost Factory Mechanoids and Mechanoid Upgrades mods for RimWorld. It includes a comprehensive mental compendium of technical knowledge for the items you create.

7.name: Scientific Method
7.description: "Testable predictions of observable phenomena." - You gain the equivalent of higher education in a field of scientific methodology. You know how to apply methodologies from societies many years ahead of humanity to your scientific research. It should help you in many small ways. Your skills and knowledge are average by the standards of this futuristic society. However, you have many blank spaces for knowledge and context lying beond scientific methodology field.

7.name: Computing Tree
7.description: This perk gives you the ability to research and discover technologies from the Computing Tech Tree of the Stellaris game unnaturally fast. Progression is semi-random, utilizes a card shuffle approach, and requires you to create and use various devices, explore the technologies of others and being proactive. Your actions make details from some technologies more probable to appear than others the next time inspiration strikes. You can pay an additional 250 CP now or the next time you roll this perk to instantly unlock a portion of the tree. You can do this as many times as you want if you have points to spare. Each time, it grants you an immediate leap in knowledge, blueprints, and skills, covering a few of the lowest technologies still ahead of you in this tree (usually between one and two). It doesn't include Starter Technologies and Events.

7.description: This perk gives you the ability to research and discover technologies from the Field Manipulation Tree of the Stellaris game unnaturally fast. It doesn't include Events.

7.name: Cybrex Mining Hub
7.description: "To build their ring world, the Cybrex relied on highly efficient mining drones to survey and harvest orbital resources. Cybrex-made memory chips and sensors could outfit our own mining drones, so that we might put their millennia old algorithms to good use."

7.name: Irassian Naval Yards
7.description: "The Irassian astronaval tradition was unmatched in their time. Their shipyards produced a constant stream of ships for their navy and merchant fleets, which would ultimately be their downfall. With so many ships, and such a high reliance on them, the Irassians were powerless to quarantine the disease that would claim their empire."

7.name: Yuht Astronomical Interferometer
7.description: "The Yuht were a paradoxical society, obsessed with the idea of finding other sentient species, yet refusing to accept that they were not alone. They were so focused on disproving any claim of alien life, that their bias found a way into their technology. However, with the proper modifications and calibrations, we could certainly fix their powerful detection arrays."

7.name: Zroni Storm Caster
7.description: "Zro is a fascinating element, prone to chaotic bursts of energy. We believe that with the right artifacts, we could use it to fuel spatial storms over entire solar systems."

7.name: First League Filing Offices
7.description: "The sprawling empire of the First League dwarfed our own at its peak, and relied on implacable bureaucracy to keep the wheels of the state in motion. The quantic filing arrays they used afforded them unprecedented efficiency in the sorting and storing of documents."

7.name: Baol Organic Plant
7.description: "The Baol Organism had a unique way of producing tools. Given the species' relative slowness, they would simply grow them out of organic matter in locations that were half orchard, half factory. With the proper genetic adjustments, we could also grow various commodities and tools alongside our regular crops."

7.name: Vultaum Reality Computer
7.description: "The reality computers of the Vultaums were unique processing units, dedicated to analyzing existence itself, not quite through physics, but rather by trying to reverse engineer reality's source code and find the glitch that would finally allow the Vultaums to take down the simulation where they believed they lived."

7.name: Industry Tree
7.description: This perk gives you the ability to research and discover technologies from the Industry Tree of the Stellaris game unnaturally fast. Progression is semi-random, utilizes a card shuffle approach, and requires you to create and use various devices, explore the technologies of others and being proactive. Your actions make details from some technologies more probable to appear than others the next time inspiration strikes. You can pay an additional 300 CP now or the next time you roll this perk to instantly unlock a portion of the tree. You can do this as many times as you want if you have points to spare. It doesn't include Starter Technologies and Events.
