It doesn't include Starter Technologies and Events.

7.name: Active Countermeasures
7.description: "The best defense is a good offense." This perks make you an expert in planning and building relatively primitive Sentinel Point-Defense systems.

7.name: High-Energy Capacitors
7.description: "Capacitors capable of storing vast amounts of energy is one of the cornerstones for any modern civilization." You posess a theoretical knowledge and a few variations of blueprints to make High-Energy Capacitors, and a degree of skill to produce and use them

7.name: Deflectors
7.description: "Energy deflector screens can stop a limited amount of incoming enemy fire before overloading. Their main drawback is that they consume large amounts of power." You gain insight into Deflector technology, theory behind it and several blueprints to apply it.

7.name: Fission Power
7.description: "This energy source generates power for ships through induced fission, but it also produces harmful nuclear waste." You gain the equivalent of higher education in the field of fission power. Your skills and knowledge are average by the standards of this futuristic society. However, you have many gaps in your knowledge and context beyond the fission power field.

7.name: Reactor Boosters
7.description: "Additional power generation systems increase the ship's reactor output." You gain blueprints and a basic theoretical understanding sufficient to construct Reactor Boosters yourself.

7.name: Hyperspace Travel
7.description: "Like the strands of a spider web, the extra-dimensional realm of hyperspace runs between the gravity wells of most stars. Faster-than-light travel is theoretically possible along these hyperlanes." You gain insight into the theory of hyperspace travel and a few blueprints of devices to experimentally prove parts of it.

7.name: Red Lasers
7.description: "Laser weapons fire focused beams of light at targets, causing damage through the generation of intense heat." You are a skillful engineer specializing in the maintenance and construction of Red Laser weapons.

7.name: Subspace Drive
7.description: "An insight born of a desperate desire to leave our home, these Subspace Drive engines were designed to facilitate limited interstellar travel. While only allowing small-scale jumps, they provide a unique opportunity to jump-start our galactic exploration." You gain a blueprint and just enough skill to start and complete the Subspace Drive engine megaproject, but nearly no theoretical context beyond needed.

7.name: Fruit Gardens
7.description: "Vacuum gardens full of bio-engineered fruits, genetically enhanced to attract spaceborne fauna." You know how to build such gardens and bio-engineer a variety of organisms for them.

7.name: Medical Care
7.description: "A micro-unit of prevention is worth a macro-unit of cure. However, sometimes both are needed." You are a doctor with education from a future society with average level of capability by thier standarts.

7.name: Industrial Agriculture
7.description: "Large-scale industrial farms growing nutrient-rich produce allow a civilization to increase its population manifold." You have the expertise of someone who used to run and oversee the construction of such large-scale industrial farms.

7.name: Energy Burster
7.description: "Fires bio-projectiles that emit bursts of energy upon impact, subtly enhancing the maneuverability of our vessels." Blueprints and skills to grow/create such devices are in your mental library.

7.name: Vector Lock Cannon
7.description: "Biologically enhanced projectiles are fired, countering evasive maneuvers and striking agile targets." Blueprints and skills to grow/create such devices are in your mental library.

7.name: Maulers
7.description: "Breakthroughs in bio-engineering have allowed the growth of space-faring, FTL-capable craft with military applications." Blueprints and skills to grow/create such devices are in your mental library along with average skills to pilot one.

7.name: Weavers
7.description: "Building on the foundations of early bio-engineering, Weavers are crafted to balance agility with increased combat capabilities." Blueprints and skills to grow/create such devices are in your mental library along with average skills to pilot one.

7.name: Planetary Defenses
7.description: "There may come a time when intellects, vast and cool and unsympathetic, regard our worlds with envy and draw plans against us. We must be ready." You are an expert of average skill in planetary defence planning and overseeing.

7.name: New Worlds Protocol
7.description: "Calculating required resources and gear required to establish a planetary colony allows us to herd brave pioneers into grand "ark ships", confident that they will survive the long voyage across the stars to a new home." You know new world protocols and have basic skills to apply them.

7.name: Planetary Germination
7.description: "To spread our roots to a new world, we first need to prepare the seedbed. By terraforming a planet, we can ensure that our colonies get off to a healthy start." You are an expert of average skill, who oversees and help planning terraforming colonization projects.

7.name: Planetary Government
7.description: "Once a colony has been firmly established and pioneers turn into citizens, the need for a strong local government providing stability trumps the colonial need for flexibility." You are an expert in the field of planetary governing with an average level of education according to future individualist society standards.

7.name: Planetary Plexus
7.description: "Our colonies would wither to naught without the stable projection of our collective self. Our effortless presence ensures a flourishing hive." You have theoretical knowledge and talent at planetary governing practices of hive mind type of future society.

7.name: Planetary Instantiation
7.description: "Our colonies would never achieve stable operation without infrastructure dedicated to our networked self." You have theoretical knowledge and talent at planetary governing practices of hive mind type of machine intelligence type of future society.

7.name: Holo-Entertainment
7.description: "The latest in holographic entertainment. Entire worlds built out of photons and energy fields." You are an average-skilled expert in holo-engineering and design.

7.name: Interplanetary Commerce
7.description: "With new planetary markets comes new opportunities for commerce. Business will be booming." You are an average-skilled expert in interplanetary commerce.

7.name: Sociocultural History
7.description: "An understanding of a shared past is necessary in order to make any significant strides into the future." You are an expert historian and monument builder of average skill from future society.

7.name: Synaptic Structures
7.description: "Through the development of macroscopic synaptic nodes, the will of the Hive will be strengthened." You have blueprints on how to build and instructions on how to operate various synaptic structures of hive-mind-type future society.

7.name: Industrial Base
7.description: "The basic industrial infrastructure that is required to become a spacefaring civilization." You have an extensive theoretical base and exceptional talent in planning and building basic industrial infrastructure at the level of a future society. Although, no specific blueprints.

7.name: Offworld Construction
7.description: "Construction in space presents our engineers with new design challenges that must be solved before we can build orbital stations above other worlds." You have an extensive theoretical base and exceptional talent in offworld construction planning and building at the level of a future society. Although, no specific blueprints.

7.name: Mechanized Mining
7.description: "The basic industrial infrastructure that is required to become a spacefaring civilization." You have a mental compendium of blueprints and instructions on how to plan, build, operate, and maintain the basic industrial infrastructure of a future civilization. However, you have no practical skills.

7.name: Nanocomposite Materials
7.description: "Reinforced nanocomposite hull plating can provide an extra layer of protection that could be the difference between life and death in a combat situation." You are an expert in a field of nanocomposite materials. You know how to make and apply them, and some theory behind how they fundamentally work.

7.name: Chemical Thrusters
7.description: "Simple yet moderately effective chemical thrusters that rely on combustible propellant to function." You have a mental compendium of blueprints and instructions on how to plan, build, operate, and maintain chemical thrusters of a future civilization level technology. However, you have no practical skills.

7.name: Flak Battery
7.description: "Gun batteries that fire shrapnel rounds at close range. They are particularly lethal to enemy strike craft, but can also defend against missiles." You have a mental compendium of blueprints and instructions on how to plan, build, operate, and maintain flak battery weaponary of a future civilization level technology. However, you have no practical skills.

7.name: Nuclear Missiles
7.description: "Space-to-space missiles equipped with high-yield nuclear warheads. Although based on old pre-space technology, these crude fire-and-forget weapons can be surprisingly effective at range." You have a mental compendium of blueprints and instructions on how to plan, build, operate, and maintain space-to-space nuclear missiles weaponary of a future civilization level technology. However, you have no practical skills.

7.name: Mass Drivers
7.description: "These electromagnetic projectile launchers use magnets to accelerate armor-piercing rounds towards targets at high speeds." You can build one from scratch and modify them in a few ways, but you don't actually know how they work fundamentally. Just how to make, operate and maintain them.

7.name: Space Exploration
7.description: "The Science Ship is used as a base of operations for a top Scientist, ready to explore the vastness of space." You can build, maintain, and operate such a ship with suitable tools on hand, but you lack an extensive theoretical background about why it is constructed this way.

7.name: Interplanetary Expeditionary Forces
7.description: "The invasion of another world is a staggering enterprise. There are immense logistical challenges that must be overcome before we can muster our first interplanetary armies." You have education in military logistics of interplanetary forces.

7.name: Deep Space Defenses
7.description: "This will enable the construction of defensive deep space platforms to protect our Starbases." You know how to build, operate, maintain and modify simple defensive deep space platforms.

7.name: Orbital Energy Conversion
7.description: "Advances in solar panel technology could offset the operating costs of our starbases. The panels would require an entire starbase module to generate enough energy, however." You know how to build, operate, maintain and modify such panels, and also basic theory behind thier inner working.

7.name: Starbase Construction
7.description: "A centralized space installation built in close orbit around the system primary is necessary to make full use of the resources in a star system." You can build, maintain, and operate such a base with suitable tools on hand, but you lack an extensive theoretical background about why it is constructed this way.

7.name: Starport
7.description: "The earliest starbases were little more than makeshift outposts. Permanent starports will enable us to maintain a firmer grip on star systems." You can build, maintain, and operate such a base with suitable tools on hand, but you lack an extensive theoretical background about why it is constructed this way.

7.name: Corvettes
7.description: "The Corvette is the most basic military ship, armed and ready in the event of hostile contacts." You can build, maintain, and operate such a base with suitable tools on hand, but you lack an extensive theoretical background about why it is constructed this way.

7.name: Event Computing Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Event Computing Technology to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Event Field Manipulation Ttechnologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Event Field Manipulation Ttechnologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Event Particles Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Event Particles Technologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Biology Event Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Biology Event Technologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Predatory Tactics
7.description: "Just like how clever pre-FTLs move to conceal each other as they approach an enemy, so too can our pilots move faster without disrupting their cloaking field."

7.name: Alien Topography
7.description: "Civilizations flourish in locations that promotes growth, and by analyzing where the majority of pre-FTL settlements thrive we can gain more out of our colonies."

7.name: Statecraft Event Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Statecraft Event Technologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Psionics Event Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Psionics Event Technologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Lost Building Methods
7.description: "Any civilization with a long enough history has examples of great wonders built by forgotten ancients which can no longer be replicated. Luckily for us we have documented these great ancients when they appeared on pre-FTL worlds."

7.name: Leviathan Tech Genesis
7.description: "Utilizing the received knowledge seized from Leviathans, we now have access to new improvements for our frames."

7.name: Event Materials Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Event Materials Technologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Event Propulsion Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Event Propulsion Technologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Event Voidcraft Technologies
7.description: This perk gives you one randomly chosen Event Voidcraft Technologies to learn blueprints, general theory, and gain skills to apply this discovery. If the technology you rolled requires another Event Technology to function, you get that one instead. Can be rolled several times. Rolling something you already have gives you nothing, but you don't lose any CP.

7.name: Stellaris Species
7.description: You are an expert focused on the biology of different types of sentient species from the Stellaris game, including species packs. Your scientific knowledge about the diverse and unique biologies of alien species is extensive and profound.

8.name: Engrams Creation
8.description: You have insight into the creation of Engrams and the method of their implantation into the minds of others. These Engrams let you share recipes and blueprints you know with other people. They even allow them to craft things that are not usually craftable - tinkertech and similiar recipes obtained from your perks. However, there are limitations on how complex an Engram can be, so you cannot share the ability to build all types of technology. This perk works better for technology from ARK perks, but you can figure out how to encode creations from other perks you possess. People can use implanted Engram to craft whatever technology you included into it.

8.name: Tekgrams Creation
8.description: You have insight into the creation of Tekgrams and the method of their implantation into the minds of others. These Tekgrams allow you to share recipes and blueprints you know with other people. They even enable them to craft things that are not usually craftable - tinkertech and similar recipes obtained from your perks. This perk essentially provides an upgrade for Engrams, allowing you to share the capability to build any technology with others - one Tekgram at a time! This perk requires Engrams to be purchased to function. If you don't have it, rolling Tekgrams will automatically buy Engrams, provided you have enough CP to afford it.

8.name: Low Engrams
8.description: Gain access to recipes from all Engrams up to level 50 in ARK: Survival Evolved base game. Includes basic skills to use all creations.

8.name: High Engrams
8.description: Gain access to recipes from all Engrams above level 50 and up to level 100 in ARK: Survival Evolved base game. Includes basic skills to use all creations.

8.name: Tek Recipes
8.description: Gain access to recipes from all Tekgrams in ARK: Survival Evolved base game. Includes basic skills to use all creations and scientific understanding of technology.

8.name: Scorched Earth Engrams
8.description: Gain access to recipes from all Engrams in Scorched Earth DLC for ARK: Survival Evolved. Includes basic skills to use all creations.

8.name: Aberration Engrams
8.description: Gain access to recipes from all Engrams in Aberration DLC for ARK: Survival Evolved. Includes basic skills to use all creations.

8.name: Extinction Engrams
8.description: Gain access to recipes from all Engrams in Extinction DLC for ARK: Survival Evolved. Includes basic skills to use all creations.

8.name: Genesis Engrams
8.description: Gain access to recipes from all Engrams in Genesis DLC parts 1&2 for ARK: Survival Evolved. Includes basic skills to use all creations.

9.name: The Hallow Spreads
9.description: This perk allows you to generate the Hallow biome from Terraria, transforming the area a few kilometers around you. It will spread slowly afterward, but the speed and effectiveness depend on the nature of the place, including flora, fauna, and the resistance of materials and details of the geography. You can hold this effect in storage until you find a suitable place to target. You can buy this perk multiple times, with a 300 CP discount after the first purchase, stacking these held activations of the ability to use later. The first purchase of the perk grants you encyclopedic knowledge of the Hallow biome.

9.name: The Crimson Spreads
9.description: This perk allows you to generate the Crimson biome from Terraria, transforming the area a few kilometers around you. It will spread slowly afterward, but the speed and effectiveness depend on the nature of the place, including flora, fauna, and the resistance of materials and details of the geography. You can hold this effect in storage until you find a suitable place to target. You can buy this perk multiple times, with a 300 CP discount after the first purchase, stacking these held activations of the ability to use later. The first purchase of the perk grants you encyclopedic knowledge of the Crimson biome.

9.name: The Corruption Spreads
9.description: This perk allows you to generate the Corruption biome from Terraria, transforming the area a few kilometers around you. It will spread slowly afterward, but the speed and effectiveness depend on the nature of the place, including flora, fauna, and the resistance of materials and details of the geography. You can hold this effect in storage until you find a suitable place to target. You can buy this perk multiple times, with a 300 CP discount after the first purchase, stacking these held activations of the ability to use later. The first purchase of the perk grants you encyclopedic knowledge of the Corruption biome.

9.name: Terraria Tools
9.description: You can craft tools from the Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Terraria Weapons
9.description: You can craft weapons and ammunition from the Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Terraria Armor
9.description: You can craft armor from the Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Terraria Accessories
9.description: You can craft all types of accessories from the Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Terraria Consumables
9.description: You can craft all types of consumables (potions, food, drinks, flasks, dyes, paints) from the Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: We Are Rich!
9.description: This perk allows you to spawn twelve full chests containing different coins, gems, and bars in targeted locations without causing any damage. If there is not enough space, fewer chests will spawn. They contain currency and Terraria-type resources inside them (giving them unique properties). You can hold onto this effect to activate it when a suitable target is found, and you can stack stored effects indefinitely. This perk can be purchased multiple times. The quantity of specific materials inside the chests depends on their rarity and usefulness in the game. There will be more early-game materials in these chests than late-game ones. It includes materials from mods, if you have perks for them.

9.name: Terraria Crafts
9.description: You gain a mental compendium of blueprints to create all furniture, crafting stations, statues, blocks, walls, and vanity items from the Terraria game. You acquire just enough skill to build them and just enough knowledge to utilize these items.

9.name: More Life
9.description: This perk grants you the equivalent of one Life Crystal or Fruit use, depending on how many times you have already rolled and bought this perk. You can purchase this perk multiple times - up to 35 times, to be exact. First, you go through 15 Life Crystal equivalents, then through 20 Life Fruit equivalents. Each time, it slightly increases your life energy and your ability to survive damage.

9.name: More Mana
9.description: This perk grants you the equivalent of one Mana Crystal use, depending on how many times you have already rolled and bought this perk. You can purchase this perk multiple times - up to 10 times, to be exact. First time you gain access to Terraria mana, and each time afterwards make your reserves a little bit bigger.

9.name: Summoned Help
9.description: You can craft items for summoning pets and mounts from the Terraria game, along with skills to command them. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Calamity Expansion
9.description: You can craft all types of items from the Calamity mod (including addons) for Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Starlight River Mod
9.description: You can craft all types of items from the Starlight River mod for Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Redemption Mod
9.description: You can craft all types of items from the Redemption mod for Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Thorium Mod
9.description: You can craft all types of items from the Thorium mod for Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

9.name: Spirit Expansion
9.description: You can craft all types of items from the Spirit mod (its various version) for Terraria game, including unobtainable and hardcore ones. They have their special properties preserved due to the supernatural component of the perk. You can use normal variants of materials to craft them, but this will make them more like tinkertech in a negative way. Ideally, you should choose variations of materials from the Terraria game or at least similar enough resources from other sources to get the best results. This perk only gives boost to skills, while you are working on things included into the perk. But you still can slowly learn some mundane things from exposure to crafting process.

10.name: Chthonian Lore
10.description: "Chthonians, horrors from the Void, are the things of nightmares. Prior to the Grim Dawn, Chthonians would only be seen upon Cairn following an arcane ritual gone wrong or at the beckoning of a powerful sorcerer. Despite an effort to exterminate the practice, a cult has formed around blood rituals and the worship of Chthonic beings. Members of the cult have been overheard chanting one name in particular: Ch'thon. With the world in disarray, the cult has grown strong, garnering new followers desperate for answers in a world that no longer makes sense. Chthonians, and their loyal cult, appear to be at odds with the Aetherials, eagerly harvesting helpless humans for blood so that the Aetherials cannot use them as vessels." You gain a deep insight into Chthonian lore, the ability to actually call upon these powers to produce various effects, and even thin out boundaries so that things from the Void can slip into your current reality (not sure why you would do that). The infohazardous knowledge granted by this perk is hidden from you; if it would harm you, you won't perceive it. Be wary - dabbling in such powers too much might attract the attention of something bigger on the other side, even if you intended otherwise, simply because you were not careful.

10.name: Aetherial Lore
10.description: "Foolishly and greedily did the arcanists of Cairn delve into the magical veil known as the Aether, never once suspecting that something was looking back. The Aetherials descended upon Cairn in what is now known as the Grim Dawn, possessing countless humans and butchering the rest. Most despicably of all, they began raising the fallen as mutated undead creatures, mindless foot soldiers for their invasion. Their very presence on Cairn is enough to mutate the wildlife, turning once docile creatures into vicious monstrosities. But most strange of all is their apparent hatred for Chthonians, as they will battle against the horrors from the Void at every opportunity." You gain a deep insight into Aetherial lore, the ability to actually call upon these powers to produce various effects, and even thin out boundaries to cause a version of 'Grim Dawn' in your current reality (not sure why you would do that). The infohazardous knowledge granted by this perk is hidden from you; if it would harm you, you won't perceive it. Be wary - dabbling in such powers too much might attract the attention of something bigger on the other side, even if you intended otherwise, simply because you were not careful.

10.name: Soldier Path
10.description: "Soldiers of the imperial army were trained to survive in the most hellish conditions and hold the line against the nastiest enemies of the empire. Soldiers prefer the use of close combat weaponry, such as a sword and shield, but can also prove formidable with firearms. What a Soldier may lack in outright damage output is made up for in fortitude and leadership." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Soldier Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Demolitionist Path
10.description: "Pyrotechnic masters of the imperial army, Demolitionists are part engineer, part sorcerer. They were used to break enemy ranks and breach fortifications with their devastating array of explosives and destructive magic. They usually prefer to fight at range, engaging enemies with guns, traps and explosives but they can also be proficient with melee weapons." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Demolitionist Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Occultist Path
10.description: "Once hunted by imperial forces in an effort to control eldritch power, the Occultist's craft focuses heavily on summoning and borrowed powers granted by the three witch "gods" Bysmiel, Solael and Dreeg. Their diverse arts include abhorrent curses and spells that inflict damage with poison, acid, and entropic energy. Excelling with neither sword nor gun, they can use either to augment their offense." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Occultist Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Nightblade Path
10.description: "Nightblades were clandestine warriors that sold their services to the great houses of the empire. Nightblades excel with all manner of martial weapons, but are even more feared for the deadly blade magic that is the secret of their trade. Nightblades are not suited to go toe to toe with tougher enemies and rely on illusion to close for quick, devastating attacks or fight from a distance with phantasmal blades." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Nightblade Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Arcanist Path
10.description: "To Arcanists, the manifestation of magic is not some unexplainable mystery or the will of the gods, but a science meant to be unraveled. This pursuit of knowledge drives all Arcanists, always eager to discover a new technique to make their namesake. Arcanists warp the mysterious aether and elements to their will, creating devastating demonstrations of power that rival small armies. However, such raw force leaves little in terms of defense." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Arcanist Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Shaman Path
10.description: "Hailing from the untamed northlands, Shamans were the spiritual leaders and guardians of their people. Claiming an astounding attunement to the wilds and their patron deity Mogdrogen, Shamans are capable of wielding the terrible forces of nature against their foes or even calling upon savage beasts to come to their aid. Shamans excel in the use of brutal two-handed melee weapons, but can easily adapt to other tools of war when conjuring their primal powers." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Shaman Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Inquisitor Path
10.description: "Trained by the secretive Luminari Order, inquisitors were officially sanctioned by the Erulan Emperor to hunt down and eliminate all eldritch and arcane threats to the empire. This dangerous and thankless duty necessitated some unconventional means of combat, including using the powers of their very enemies against them." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Inquisitor Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Necromancer Path
10.description: "Although they primarily engage in the weaving of magic, necromancers are aptly equipped to enter the fray in close quarters, or to weave their death magic into ranged weaponry. Do not for a moment think that a cornered necromancer is easy prey." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Necromancer Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Oathkeeper Path
10.description: "Driven by divine purpose and celestial fire in their hearts, Oathkeepers are a terror to the enemies of humanity. Their wills unbending, their faith their shield. None can withstand the righteous fury of a fully trained Oathkeeper. Oathkeepers may be servants of divine forces, but such forces may not always hold humanity in high regard or be sanctioned by the fallen Erulan Empire. Some Oathkeepers serve dark and corrupted powers, others see salvation in the light of Empyrion; others still believe that the Witch Gods are the only true gods and through their blessing they become a force of change upon Cairn." You gain starting skills and ability to progress on the path of Oathkeeper Mastery from Grim Dawn game unusually fast.

10.name: Blueprints: Weapons
10.description: You gain the mental compendium of all blueprints, which can be found and collected in the game, for weapons and the ability to build them. You only have high skills, deep insight, and mystical powers when creating something from these blueprints. However, over time, some mundane or even more supernatural pieces of skills and knowledge might stick to you through the practice of crafting these items.

However, over time, some mundane or even more supernatural pieces of skills and knowledge might stick to you through the practice of crafting these items.

10.name: Consumables Recipes

You only have high skills, deep insight, and mystical powers when creating something from these recipes. However, over time, some mundane or even more supernatural pieces of skills and knowledge might stick to you through the practice of crafting these items.

10.name: Augment Making Recipes
10.description: "Augments are enchanted powders, tinctures and poisons that can be used to empower weapons, rings, and amulets. An item may have only one augment on it at any given time, and applying a new augment overwrites the old one. Salvaging or dismantling an augmented item does not return the augment." You gain ability to craft all augments from the game, apply them effectively. You can even tweak recipes slightly or use auguments in creative ways. However, you only have high skills, deep insight, and mystical powers when creating something from these recipes. Although, over time, some mundane or even more supernatural pieces of skills and knowledge might stick to you through the practice of crafting these items.

10.name: Item Set Creation
10.description: You gain the mental compendium of all blueprints for items from different sets and the ability to make them. You only have high skills, deep insight, and mystical powers when creating something from these recipes. However, over time, some mundane or even more supernatural pieces of skills and knowledge might stick to you through the practice of crafting these items. Via practice you can start applying 'item set' mechanic to different things and even create your own unique item sets. Although, they still will be somehow themed around Grim Dawn mechanics.

10.name: Common Items
10.description: You have just enough knowledge and skill to make all common quality items from Grim Dawn, along with basic skills to actually use them. Your skill set is pretty narrow and focused on these specific types of items, which makes using them for other purposes a bit problematic and requires additional training.

10.name: Components Creation
10.description: You are able to produce components from the Grim Dawn game using relatively mundane resources. You also can apply or utilize them on different pieces of equipment to affect their properties or add new ones. This process is quite mysterious, just like the resulting components.

10.name: Devotion Constellations
10.description: This perk gives you one devotion point to spend on stars from Grim Dawn constellations, granting you some boons and effects the have. Although they are not the same as in the game, they are inspired by it and warped by the actual meanings and ideas these constellations represent, and your personality, your nature. You have a general knowledge of their lore. Be careful, because this might have some unexpected side effects. This perk can be purchased multiple times. You don't have to spend the obtained devotion points - they can be stored indefinitely and used whenever you feel like it. After buying all the stars from all the constellations, you gain the ability to give these points to other people after each purchase of the perk.

11.name: Skill Gems
11.description: You are capable of making skill gems and item sockets to apply them to different objects. You also have encyclopedic knowledge of all skill gems from the Path of Exile game and skills at how to use them.

11.name: Not Enough Flasks
11.description: You are capable of making various flasks from the Path of Exile game. You also have encyclopedic knowledge of them and a general idea of how to use them. Their way of working is highly inspired by the in-game mechanics.

11.name: Quality Items
11.description: You can spend additional time and resources to apply higher quality to the targeted item, inspired by Path of Exile game mechanics. It is harder to do with types of items that are not included in the game as part of the Quality mechanic. The process is also more tedious and costly, proportional to the complexity and power of the targeted item. Quality is easier to apply when you create an item from scratch.

11.name: Complete Modifier
11.description: You can apply modifiers inspired by the Path of Exile game mechanic to your creations. Anything you made yourself - such as a device, weapon, armor, landmark, creature, etc. - is a valid target for applying a modifier, while its a in a process of being made by you. However, it works best on things similar to the entities modified usually in the original game. The cost in time and resources also scales proportionally with the power of the modifiers and the nature of the targeted creation.

11.name: Beastcrafting
11.description: "Beastcrafting is a method of crafting by sacrificing beasts to the blood altar in the Menagerie. Each beastcrafting recipe requires four beasts to be sacrificed, with most of them requiring one or two specific Red Beast, and the rest any Rare Beast. The four chosen beasts are released into the arena surrounding the blood altar and must be killed to complete the recipe. If the player dies during the attempt, the recipe fails and the beasts are lost." - Now you have the ability to use this mechanic in form of a ritual.

11.name: Bow Gamble
11.description: This perk gives you a random unique bow from the Path of Exile game and the ability to create this specific bow. If you roll the same bow again from this perk, you gain a bit more insight into the actual magic and science behind its creation or the ability to modify the original recipe a little. It gradually reveals more with each repetition. You don't have to summon your prize instantly - you can hold onto it until a better time comes. This perk can be purchased multiple times.
